DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to describe the form in which biospecimen material was submitted for review or evaluation.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a specimen being submitted.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes.

Concepts.definition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: Submitted; referred for judgment or consideration.

Concepts.definition: The act of referring for judgment or consideration by others; the act of handing over something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: released; merged information from duplicate DEC #2012957

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis._Submitted; referred for judgment or consideration.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Tissue that is preserved and embedded in paraffin: Blocks; refers to preserved specimens embedded in support material.

Concepts.definition: Tissue that is preserved and embedded in paraffin.
Refers to preserved specimens embedded in support material.  These are typically cut into thin slices for microscopic examination, with or without an enhancement such as staining.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A flat rectangular piece of glass on which specimens can be mounted for microscopic study.

Concepts.definition: A flat rectangular piece of glass on which specimens can be mounted for microscopic study.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A specimen that has been subjected to and immobilized by severe cold.

Concepts.definition: A specimen that has been subjected to and immobilized by severe cold.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A colorless poisonous gas synthesized by the oxidation of methanol and used as an antiseptic, disinfectant, histologic fixative, and general-purpose chemical reagent for laboratory applications.  Formaldehyde is readily soluble in water and is commonly distributed as a 37% solution in water; formalin, a 10% solution of formaldehyde in water, is used as a disinfectant and to preserve biological specimens. Environmentally, formaldehyde may be found in the atmosphere, smoke from fires, automobile exhaust and cigarette smoke.  Small amounts are produced during normal metabolic processes in most organisms, including humans. (NCI04): Tissue which is preserved in a fixative solution, usually formalin.: Tissue that is preserved and embedded in paraffin

Concepts.definition: A colorless poisonous gas synthesized by the oxidation of methanol and used as an antiseptic, disinfectant, histologic fixative, and general-purpose chemical reagent for laboratory applications. Formaldehyde is readily soluble in water and is commonly distributed as a 37% solution in water; formalin, a 10% solution of formaldehyde in water, is used as a disinfectant and to preserve biological specimens. Environmentally, formaldehyde may be found in the atmosphere, smoke from fires, automobile exhaust and cigarette smoke. Small amounts are produced during normal metabolic processes in most organisms, including humans.
Tissue which is preserved in a fixative solution, usually formalin.
Tissue that is preserved and embedded in paraffin.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Extracted DNA from Formalin Fixed Paraffin Embedded Block

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Extracted DNA from Formalin Fixed Paraffin Embedded Block
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A colorless poisonous gas synthesized by the oxidation of methanol and used as an antiseptic, disinfectant, histologic fixative, and general-purpose chemical reagent for laboratory applications.  Formaldehyde is readily soluble in water and is commonly distributed as a 37% solution in water; formalin, a 10% solution of formaldehyde in water, is used as a disinfectant and to preserve biological specimens. Environmentally, formaldehyde may be found in the atmosphere, smoke from fires, automobile exhaust and cigarette smoke.  Small amounts are produced during normal metabolic processes in most organisms, including humans. (NCI04): Tissue which is preserved in a fixative solution, usually formalin.: Tissue that is preserved and embedded in paraffin: Blocks; refers to preserved specimens embedded in support material.: The act of pulling out, including the process of obtaining something from a mixture or compound by chemical or physical or mechanical means.: A long linear double-stranded polymer formed from nucleotides attached to a deoxyribose backbone and found in the nucleus of a cell; associated with the transmission of genetic information.

Concepts.definition: A colorless poisonous gas synthesized by the oxidation of methanol and used as an antiseptic, disinfectant, histologic fixative, and general-purpose chemical reagent for laboratory applications. Formaldehyde is readily soluble in water and is commonly distributed as a 37% solution in water; formalin, a 10% solution of formaldehyde in water, is used as a disinfectant and to preserve biological specimens. Environmentally, formaldehyde may be found in the atmosphere, smoke from fires, automobile exhaust and cigarette smoke. Small amounts are produced during normal metabolic processes in most organisms, including humans.
Tissue which is preserved in a fixative solution, usually formalin.
Tissue that is preserved and embedded in paraffin.
Refers to preserved specimens embedded in support material.  These are typically cut into thin slices for microscopic examination, with or without an enhancement such as staining.
The act of pulling out, including the process of obtaining something from a mixture or compound by chemical or physical or mechanical means.
A long linear double-stranded polymer formed from nucleotides attached to a deoxyribose backbone and found in the nucleus of a cell; associated with the transmission of genetic information.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.: To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.: A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.: To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.: The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.
The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Formalin Fixed Paraffin Embedded Tissue Scroll

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Formalin Fixed Paraffin Embedded Tissue Scroll
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A colorless poisonous gas synthesized by the oxidation of methanol and used as an antiseptic, disinfectant, histologic fixative, and general-purpose chemical reagent for laboratory applications. Formaldehyde is readily soluble in water and is commonly distributed as a 37% solution in water; formalin, a 10% solution of formaldehyde in water, is used as a disinfectant and to preserve biological specimens. Environmentally, formaldehyde may be found in the atmosphere, smoke from fires, automobile exhaust and cigarette smoke. Small amounts are produced during normal metabolic processes in most organisms, including humans.: Tissue which is preserved in a fixative solution, usually formalin.: Tissue that is preserved and embedded in paraffin.: A piece of tissue cut on a microtome so that it rolls up on itself, giving it an appearance similar to a paper scroll.

Concepts.definition: A colorless poisonous gas synthesized by the oxidation of methanol and used as an antiseptic, disinfectant, histologic fixative, and general-purpose chemical reagent for laboratory applications. Environmentally, formaldehyde may be found in the atmosphere, smoke from fires, automobile exhaust and cigarette smoke. Small amounts are produced during normal metabolic processes in most organisms, including humans.
Tissue which is preserved in a fixative solution, usually formalin.
Tissue that is preserved and embedded in paraffin.
A piece of tissue cut on a microtome so that it rolls up on itself, giving it an appearance similar to a paper scroll.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: To freeze rapidly so as to preserve structure and prevent ice crystal formation.

Concepts.definition: To freeze rapidly so as to preserve structure and prevent ice crystal formation.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Optimal Cutting Temperature Embedded Frozen Specimen

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Optimal Cutting Temperature Embedded Frozen Specimen
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A solution of water soluble glycols and resins that provide a specimen support matrix for cryostat sectioning at temperatures of -10 degrees C and below.: To surround an object with a firm chemical substance such as wax or resin, in order to perform cutting of thin sections for microscopic examination.: A specimen that has been subjected to and immobilized by severe cold.

Concepts.definition: A solution of water soluble glycols and resins that provide a specimen support matrix for cryostat sectioning at temperatures of -10 degrees C and below.
To surround an object with a firm chemical substance such as wax or resin, in order to perform cutting of thin sections for microscopic examination.
A specimen that has been subjected to and immobilized by severe cold.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: One of the portions into which something is regarded as divided and which together constitute a whole.

Concepts.definition: One of the portions into which something is regarded as divided and which together constitute a whole.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.: A dye or other coloring material that is used in microscopy to make structures visible.: A flat rectangular piece of glass on which specimens can be mounted for microscopic study.

Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
